brief_summary.textblock:
OBJECTIVES: I.  Evaluate the efficacy of oral ribose in patients with a complex
      5'-nucleotidase syndrome who have not received uridine (UR) and thymidine (TDR).

      II.  Evaluate the efficacy of UR/oral ribose and UR/TDR. III.  Evaluate the efficacy of oral
      ribose given in combination with UR/TDR.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase II Study of Ribose, Uridine, and Thymidine for a Complex Syndrome Involving Excessive 5'-Nucleotidase Activity

detailed_description.textblock:
PROTOCOL OUTLINE: Newly identified patients receive ribose daily for 8 weeks.  Patients who
      improve continue therapy.  If improvement then reaches a plateau, uridine (UR) and thymidine
      (TDR) are added to the regimen.

      Patients who receive no benefit after 8 weeks of ribose are treated with UR/TDR.  Patients
      who improve after 8 weeks of this combination continue therapy.

      Ribose is added to the treatment regimen for patients on UR/TDR at entry.  At maximal
      improvement, TDR and UR are sequentially tapered.

criteria.textblock:
PROTOCOL ENTRY CRITERIA:

        --Disease Characteristics-- Complex syndrome with excessive skin fibroblast
        5'-nucleotidase activity characterized by: Recurrent infection Seizure disorder Speech
        impairment Attention deficit and behavior problems --Prior/Concurrent Therapy-- Concurrent
        uridine and thymidine therapy allowed --Patient Characteristics-- Other: No pregnant women

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.
